intro: Walafrida congesta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and is well-suited for indoor cultivation. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Walafrida congesta thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and humidity to flourish.
